On 11/16/2019 at 12:49 PM, Xd the great said:

Does anyone know why my France runway is crooked? My plane bounces off it and crashed while taking off.

Try this - 
https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/186244-wip-rss-runway-fix/

On 11/6/2019 at 11:08 AM, nasaholic said:

Yay. Installed the latest version for 1.7.3 and its working flawlessly. Now my question is: is it doable without RO, and if so are there any non-RO mods that you can recommend to at least be able to reach orbit?

You can create a GravParameter.CFG file, using the following lines:

@Kopernicus:AFTER[RealSolarSystem]
{
    @name = Real Solar System
    @Body,*
    {
        @Properties
        {
            @gravParameter *= 0.25 
        }
    }
}

// Charge gravParameter to any positive number from 0.1 to 0.9  Lower the number the least amount of G's. Greater the number greater the G's.  This will change the G's to all Planets and moons.

 

Edited November 25, 2019 by znscott
Anyone figure out how to get this to work for 1.8.1? I get an endless loading screen most likely associated with Kopernicus, I've tried deleting all the other gunk in Kopernicus folder.

12 minutes ago, Likasombodee said:

Anyone figure out how to get this to work for 1.8.1? I get an endless loading screen most likely associated with Kopernicus, I've tried deleting all the other gunk in Kopernicus folder.

Well, there is no "gunk" in Kopernicus it's all necessary. Your issue is that kopernicus is not updated for 1.8.1. if you want to play RSS you need to stick to the version it's updated for which is 1.6.1.

On 11/6/2019 at 4:08 PM, nasaholic said:

Yay. Installed the latest version for 1.7.3 and its working flawlessly. Now my question is: is it doable without RO, and if so are there any non-RO mods that you can recommend to at least be able to reach orbit?

SMURFF- I use it with RSS and 1.7.3 It also means all my non RO mods like gravity turn are are still useable and tbh makes RSS an epic experience. You can make it as hard or easy as you want with Smurff.

Edited November 27, 2019 by Sunscreen

On 11/6/2019 at 8:08 AM, nasaholic said:

Yay. Installed the latest version for 1.7.3 and its working flawlessly. Now my question is: is it doable without RO, and if so are there any non-RO mods that you can recommend to at least be able to reach orbit?

It's a little self promotional but you could try this:

It rescales stock parts to something like realistic size/mass/performance, supports a few popular stock part mods, and gives the full RP-1 experience with a lot less of the realism.  If you don't want the contracts or tech tree, you can just extract the two config files from the root folder (lrtr-part-tweaks.cfg and lrtr-resize.cfg) and put them somewhere in your GameData folder.

Edited November 27, 2019 by Pehvbot

Now this might be just what the doctor ordered. Will definitely try out

Update!

RSS v16.4 for KSP 1.7.X

pap1723 released this 8 days ago

  • Integrated the RSS Runway fix from @whale2
  • Removed Version Checker

 

Should help with a borked runway in rescaled systems for good!

I don’t even know whether to put this modification ... I want to, but there are a few things that cannot be circumvented for RSS to work correctly:
1. The size of Kerbals. They were still shorties, and they remained far from real human.
2. The scale of the parts, but the engines and fuel banks can be increased. But such details as command modules and various residential structures remain for small Kerbols as before. Real humans won't even fit in there ...
I’m already silent about the fact that these are almost the same eggs as without RSS, just here the rockets need to be built thicker and the orbit will be long.

Maybe it would be better to just play with the stock Kerbal system?
While adhering to "common sense" those building rockets of size adapted to the size of Kerbin.
That is, you just need to keep in mind that ~ 30 tons of a Delta-V ~ 2400 m / s rocket will be enough to enter Kerbin with a small capsule or light cargo. Instead of exaggerating everything and building monsters like many inexperienced players do it.
Hi, I want to do some localization to this mod. What do you think?

Does anyone know why breaking ground surface features don't spawn in RSS? I tried editing the rocdef file- nothing. If there's an actual way to get them to spawn,  it would be so cool to build a colony on Europa with geysers all over the place...

Edited December 11, 2019 by Domksp
I was just wondering if there are any future plans to make use of all the newer kopernicus expansion elements to bring even more realism to the system?

I have tried using versions 1.8.1, 1.7.3, and 1.6.1 all with no success. The date and time was changed correctly, and the new launch sites appear, but the system is the same and they are spread out across Kerbins surface in strange ways. To the best of my knowledge, I have installed Kopernicus, the textures, the module manager, and RSS correctly. I put the textures into GameData and that didnt work, so I tried putting the PluginData within that folder in the main one, and that didnt work either. Is there something Im missing? I just need the Solar System to load into the game correctly. I greatly appreciate anyones help.

https://imgur.com/vMo1ieI

Hi, My Kopernicus gives me a weird message whenever I load the game and idk what's going on. it reads "Kopernicus was not able to load the planet pack due to an exception in the loading process" I would love any and all help. Thanks

You can download old versions on the kerbal shop page. go to your ksp download, scroll down to "more downloads" and click "KSP Legacy versions"

voila, 1.6.1 for a clean install.

Thanx!
